Section.Catchline: Implied warranty; merchantability; usage of trade.

Subsection.Text: Unless excluded or modified (s. 672.316), a warranty that the goods shall be merchantable is implied in a contract for their sale if the seller is a merchant with respect to goods of that kind. Under this section the serving for value of food or drink to be consumed either on the premises or elsewhere is a sale.
Goods to be merchantable must be at least such as:

Paragraph.Text: Pass without objection in the trade under the contract description; and
In the case of fungible goods, are of fair average quality within the description; and
Are fit for the ordinary purposes for which such goods are used; and
Run, within the variations permitted by the agreement, of even kind, quality and quantity within each unit and among all units involved; and
Are adequately contained, packaged, and labeled as the agreement may require; and
Conform to the promises or affirmations of fact made on the container or label if any.

Subsection.Text: Unless excluded or modified (s. 672.316) other implied warranties may arise from course of dealing or usage of trade.
